greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of bases in which n requires at least one zero to be written.
link: Eric M. Schmidt, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(9)=3 since it requires zeros when written in bases 2, 3 or 9 (as 1001, 100 or 10 respectively).
program: (Sage) def A077268(n) : return sum(0 in n.digits(m) for m in range(2,n+1)) # _Eric M. Schmidt_, Jul 09 2014
(PARI) a(n) = sum(i=2, n, ! vecmin(digits(n, i))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 09 2014
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Nov 01 2002
